ca.ualberta.taskr

Class EditTaskActivity

  • ca.ualberta.taskr.EditTaskActivity

  • public class EditTaskActivity

    Allows user to input title, description, and location for a task. The task can either be a newly created one or an existing one to be edited.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      android.widget.EditText detailsEditText
      EditText for changing task details.
      android.widget.EditText locationEditText
      EditText for displaying task location.
      android.widget.EditText titleEditText
      EditText for changing task title.
      android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EditTaskActivity()
      Allows user to input title, description, and location for a task. The task can either be a newly created one or an existing one to be edited.

      boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item) 
      void openLocationActivity()
      Starts class AddLocationToTaskActivity to allow user to select new location for task. If the task is being edited and already has a location, a LatLng] object is passed to the activity so that the map camera starts on the location.
      void postTask()
      On clicking postTaskButton, creates the new task using inputted details and posts it to the server. New/modified class Task object is passed back to previous activity.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)

        Initializes task title, details, and location if a serialized class Task object generated by class GenerateRetrofit is provided.

        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -
        See Also:
        class Task, class GenerateRetrofit, class GenerateRetrofit

      • openLocationActivity

        public void openLocationActivity()

        Starts class AddLocationToTaskActivity to allow user to select new location for task. If the task is being edited and already has a location, a LatLng] object is passed to the activity so that the map camera starts on the location.

        See Also:
        class AddLocationToTaskActivity, class AddLocationToTaskActivity, class GenerateRetrofit

      • postTask

        public void postTask()

        On clicking postTaskButton, creates the new task using inputted details and posts it to the server. New/modified class Task object is passed back to previous activity.

        See Also:
        class Task, class CachingRetrofit

      • onActivityResult

        public void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                             int resultCode,
                             android.content.Intent data)

        Receives new location for task from class AddLocationToTaskActivity.

        Parameters:
        requestCode -
        resultCode -
        data - Contains serialized LatLng object for task location
        See Also:
        class AddLocationToTaskActivity, class AddLocationToTaskActivity, class GenerateRetrofit
